documents.document: Pls spread the word. This is a great job working with me & the excellent team @360Giving! https://t.co/x3XPofZ5Vp
Open grants data - its the new normal. Check out https://t.co/w2b0YXbdab & https://t.co/KbtVf1WEZj @360Giving @fdncenter @MarketsForGood
Some fantastic ideas in this group. Looking fwd to seeing the results & sharing w/ the @360Giving community.… https://t.co/0PmEyBBYMU
Hello @SocialValueJobs. We have a great job going @360Giving, Data Labs & Learning Manager: https://t.co/YXxdOGYqX8. Pls spread the word!
Also highlights gov is late w/ publishing its spending data, despite commitments to @opencontracting & @360Giving m… https://t.co/wcvV9lLQVc
@nicolevIFG Quails eggs? Some poor person had to peel those.
Care about using open data? Like working w/ fun teams & creating change? This could be the job for you! https://t.co/YXxdOGGQ5A @360Giving
@stevieflow Was it hilarious? Embarrassing more like.
Excited about event w/ @LondonFunders in Feb: https://t.co/Nr9QRgLWn3. Hoping we might try mapping funding flows across the city. @360Giving
Hello @cityoflondon. Great new offices for @nesta_uk at 58 Victoria Embankment but only 3 bike racks outside. Pls add more. @london_cycling
@nesta_uk @RupertSimons But you can ask them for more, right? I expect they'd recognise 3 racks isn't enough. Happy to help make the case!
Thank you @mcgregor_ewan for taking a principled decision & doing it publicly. https://t.co/jNz9pNBfrf
Hello @nesta_uk. Nice new offices but only 3 bike racks for visitors. Hope you plan to add more as only 6 cyclists can park up outside.
Read @ODIHQ's interview w/ @suninthasky about Beehive Giving & their big plans in 2017: https://t.co/5oaLoMwXWs @360Giving @TechforgoodCAST
@VirginTrains Yes. I will do that. And I hope you will investigate it. Thanks.
@VirginTrains No. The exact words were "a member of staff went AWOL but we've found then now". I paid £83 for my ticket & expect better.
Hello @VirginTrains. I'm on the 13.35 from Manc to Lon. Told we're departing 23 mins late as "a member of staff went AWOL". Poor excuse.
@BridgetMcGing Its mother's ruin Bridget! (I love it too....)
.@jasonbelldata Data on failed applications to BLF: https://t.co/4qM9PL3zhf
Great point by @AndreaThornbury: Its not just gov that needs to publish open data but also implementers, incl @NICVA members. #DetailData
Are you a non-profit working in N Ireland? Check out https://t.co/0ZxK8vTp1Z. They're looking for new data projects to work on. #DetailData
.@alan_hook talking about teaching data literacy to students (& how live travel apps help w/ getting to lectures on time!). #DetailData
Some great stats from @kath_thedetail driven by analysis of public data. Examples of how data can be used for policy decisions. #DetailData
Pls use them & tell us what you think. We welcome feedback. #DetailData https://t.co/9hKIYBlx9q
@LiamMcCusker84 @360Giving @DetailData Thank you! Come & tell us how our open grants dataset helps you & what more info you'd like.
This conference is for anyone interested in using open data. You don't need to be an expert - just be willing to sh… https://t.co/txJYqsPRqD
Live/work in Dublin? Fund/deliver grants in Dublin? Check out: https://t.co/3ldgSbpl0B. #DetailData
Great mix of orgs here that I'm sure will be interested in @360Giving dataset! https://t.co/I1HOZ3pBE8
Excited to be speaking @NICVA's conference today on open data for public good. Great mix of orgs here that will find @360Giving data useful.
If you're free on 2nd Feb & interested in sustainable development then why not attend the launch of the new… https://t.co/hDEeTHDBbU
@TimJHughes Ha! We'll see Tim. Think its time to get some fresh blood...
He'll be a hard act to follow but its a great job with an organisation that makes change happen. @Global_Witness https://t.co/Jy7CjcoCdf
@alexwilks Do Alex. Think you'd be great! Have a lovey Christmas.
Ten things I didn’t know this time last year https://t.co/K3s0DMWEWT via @ncvo
@alex_vanvliet I think you look great Alex. V professional interviewee. Don't be so hard on yourself!
Hello @David_McNair @thomasmhughes @puzzlesthewill. You'd all make ideal #ogpuk Steering Committee members. Nominat… https://t.co/1nDEEVM9Qz
Hello @markcridge @willperrin @alexwilks @_karin_c. You'd all make ideal #ogpuk Steering Committee members. Nominat… https://t.co/YNjKIM857Y
Just the kind of insight you'd expect from @juliaunwin on housing; & another reason why we're keen @360Giving data… https://t.co/EWWYmDxkKj
This @CEPData report highlights CEOs' desire to be more accountable and transparent; and more proactive in addressi… https://t.co/EX2j4ENAwl
Bad news for all those #StarWars fans out there. The Temple of the Jedi Order's charity application has been refused https://t.co/DUqVOskirh
How to write a good data policy: https://t.co/1czrgtv9Fs courtsey of @ldodds & @ODIHQ.
And its out - @nominettrust's 100 most inspiring Tech for Good projects: https://t.co/sustCWW52U. Hoping @360Giving might be in it next yr!
So pleased to hear that @SunFoundation will continue under @JohnWonderlich's leadership. This is the right decision: https://t.co/Ffk0OGoYdp
And here it is: https://t.co/yyWcEDgavZ. Bit of a shock to hear how nasal I sound! https://t.co/digXKRfEfM
Great to see @JeniT listed in top 50 most influential people in IT: https://t.co/KdM71IHtHt. @ODIHQ
Just recorded my first podcast for @MarketsForGood talking about @360Giving & why open data standards matter. Fun! Thank you @meansandrew.
@nicolevIFG @aidtransparency Ah Nicole. Its like old times! You're tweeting about #IATI.
@sburall Trying writing your details down on paper using a pen. Remember those?
Oh, so my British friend who works & pays tax in Nantes shouldn't expect her French-speaking children to attend the… https://t.co/8ELwHIm9YX
This is good progress, but hope to see diesel vehicles banned from London in the future too. They have no place in… https://t.co/pM4ymHOzRK
@sburall Who would dare mute you Simon?
Calling all users of @ChtyCommission website! Feed into their digital users consultation by 18th Jan: https://t.co/ea6PTZoNoT. @360Giving
My main takeaway from the @TheBHF fine: Charities need to better understand their data mgmt responsibilities. @ICOnews has lots of guidance.
In the next 5 yrs the success of OGP will be measured by its ability to foster open gov reforms & by the implementa… https://t.co/2lnGlZ4tIn
A simple way round this is for funders to publish all their grants data so everyone knows who is funding what, wher… https://t.co/OMns1SW3qC
@ekoner @opendatacon @robredpath @DuncanJDewhurst @timdavies Is Rob trying to be cool by not wearing his security pass properly?
Calling all UK open government advocates! Nominate yourself to join the UK OGN Steering Committee: https://t.co/nxjJhmHZ2q @OpenGovUK #OGP16
Hope that we can get the @360Giving Standard on the agenda in 2017. https://t.co/HLOU0BH7iS
I hope opening up grants data might also be on the agenda? https://t.co/5t5G2IR9mN
Good luck to all those on the list. Some great ideas in there. https://t.co/rRntDCJ0MH
Timely paper by @benworthy1 on Brexit & the future open government in the UK: https://t.co/wgOr63neIO. @CampaignFoI @OpenGovUK #OGP16Summit
@David_McNair @AmalKaoua You've got the job. Congratulations. Payment is unlimited Ryanair flights.
@willperrin What! You mean I have to put on a coat and actually attend a rally? How very 1980s.
New gov guidelines on standards for grantmaking: https://t.co/TfdIo1xtpf. Good progress, but even better if they're published to @360Giving.
Hello fellow cyclists @martintisne @owenbarder @_karin_c @RupertSimons. Pls feed into the clean air consultation: https://t.co/7vwYoy4zVF.
Calling all walkers, runners & cyclists. Pls take 5 mins to complete this @MayorofLondon clear air consultation: https://t.co/7vwYoy4zVF.
Interesting piece by @My_impact_is on criticism of impact measurement: https://t.co/IB4zYdFxrr. Read the replies too! @360Giving @peoplesbiz
Attn all @IATI_aid @opencontracting & @360Giving publishers. Share your thoughts on assigning organisation prefixes: https://t.co/s2M01NLf59
Just read @DSC_Charity paper on time wasted on ineligible applications: https://t.co/AtqUXVjouP. Recommendations v relevant to @360Giving.
Well done @CarolJMack! Looking foward to working with you. https://t.co/aOHeLjEAA9
@markcridge Ooh. Interesting. Got any further info you can share Mark?
@stevieflow Celebration cake? A medal? A welcome card signed by the other 499 publishers?
Great to see @OmidyarNetwork joining @Hewlett_Found & @gatesfoundation by publishing to @IATI_aid. Hope more grant-makers will join them.
This is great. Not only has @OmidyarNetwork has published to #IATI but its got a policy on how they're doing it.… https://t.co/4Ctfj2Rzqn
@herahussain Wot?! Tell me it was a mistake.
Interesting piece on US philanthropy & leaving the white working class behind: https://t.co/UrdiS8CPmc. Some similarities w/ UK Brexit vote?
I hope someone mentions open data standards! Yes its dry, but standards helps open data & issues up so they can be… https://t.co/MGJylmcevE
Nice to get a mention, but UK gov had nothing to do w/ GrantNav so not sure why its included in the progress review… https://t.co/Xw9vPZgvhU
Glad you like it Tom. We're rather pleased with it too! tell us what else you'd like it to do. @360Giving… https://t.co/ZZ17wusDrP
@stevieflow @northernjamie Really useful. Thanks. I'll ask Jamie to remove his tiara.
Take note @stevieflow. An excellent array of choices. https://t.co/bnBsFRvco4
@northernjamie Oh I am pleased to be asked this, but suspect I'm replying too late. Strong preference for 3 so hope it made the final cut.
Looking fwd to @ACFoundations conference tmrw. Come & say hello to @360Giving & we'll show you GrantNav: https://t.co/KbtVf1WEZj. #acfconf
@stevieflow Oh finally. Now you follow me! About time...
@NissaRamsay Thanks Nissa. Couldn't do it without ongoing support and advice from others like you!
New @NPCthinks paper emphasising how transformational open grants data could be. Food for thought at @ACFoundations… https://t.co/JJ3HyHEHyP
@northernjamie Dig out a nice frock Jamie.
Thank you @ODIHQ! And for establishing an award for women in open data. Hope we can inspire others. https://t.co/daHdCAcAKK
@EmmaThwaites @360Giving Thanks Emma. And for the comms advice in the early days. Its paid off!
Great to meet some new faces at today's #ODISummit & see some familiar ones too, incl @moominlounge @EmmaThwaites @herahussain & @BrionyPhil
@stevieflow @360Giving Couldn't do it without some male support though, including @willperrin @timdavies & you.
@alex_vanvliet @cased @360Giving @ODIHQ Thanks Alex. Couldn't do it without ongoing support from people like you!
Whoop whoop! https://t.co/eqNFs5RCJI
And great to have received an @ODIHQ award from him & @JeniT today! Here's to more women in open data. https://t.co/9scUOljTWI
Looking fwd to hearing @stevieflow & @northernjamie speaking at #ODISummit tmrw. Two people who know their stuff & make it fun too. @ODIHQ
An interview with @360Giving's Katherine Duerden in advance of tmrw's #ODISummit: https://t.co/qR3CeLJ9op. Looking fwd to the awards event!
Good news! World's largest marine protected area declared in Antarctica: https://t.co/TD6Hr8O19W. Who doesn't like penguins?
This is actually brilliant: https://t.co/nkj65ECnv1. Works out the best mobile package for you. Independent & accurate. HT @andrew_c_clarke
Run your own organisation & wondering how long to keep records for? Here's a handy checklist: https://t.co/VJlMaM8owS. Thanks @BuzzacottLLP
Come & discuss charity funding relationships & open data w/ @ncvo & @3rdSectorRC: https://t.co/XpdpUEl2kP. @360Giving will be there too!
